Authors:
Stephen Cameron, Kazunori Yoshizawa, Atsushi Mizukoshi,
Michael F. Whiting, Kevin P. Johnson
Title:
Mitochondrial genome deletions and mini-circles are common in
lice (Insecta: Phthiraptera).
Abstract:
Background: The gene composition, gene order and structure
of the mitochondrial genome are remarkably stable across bilaterian
animals. Lice (Insecta: Phthiraptera) are a major exception to this
genomic stability in that the canonical single chromosome with 37 genes
found in almost all other bilaterians has been lost in multiple lineages
in favour of multiple, minicircular chromosomes with less than 37 genes
on each chromosome.
